DOC.brief_summary: OBJECTIVES : I . Confirm efficacy demonstrate pilot study use high dose cyclophosphamide patient severe aplastic anemia . II . Determine whether addition filgrastim ( G-CSF ) high dose cyclophosphamide shortens time recovery patient . III . Determine whether regimen efficacious treat paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria .
DOC.brief_title: Study High Dose Cyclophosphamide Patients With Severe Aplastic Anemia Paroxysmal Nocturnal Hemoglobinuria
DOC.detailed_description: PROTOCOL OUTLINE : Patients receive high dose cyclophosphamide IV day 1-4 . Beginning day 10 , patient receive filgrastim ( G-CSF ) absolute neutrophil count great 1,000/mm3 2 consecutive day . Patients follow every 3 month least 2 year annually thereafter .
DOC.criteria: PROTOCOL ENTRY CRITERIA : Disease Characteristics Acquired severe aplastic anemia paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria Not candidate allogeneic bone marrow transplantation Must meet one follow criterion : Severe aplastic anemia Less 25 % bone marrow cellularity depression two three blood count ( reticulocytes less 40,000/mm3 , platelet count le 20,000/mm3 granulocyte less 500/mm3 ) Lifethreatening paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria Absolute neutrophil count less 500/mm3 , platelet transfusion dependent , thrombotic disease No Fanconi anemia No abnormal cytogenetics Patient Characteristics Renal : Creatinine great 2.0 mg/dL Cardiovascular : Cardiac ejection fraction least 45 % Other : Not preterminal moribund Not pregnant
